title: theresa may brexit deal cabinet meeting
story: The Prime Minister locked senior ministers in No for a five-hour meeting where they signed up to the withdrawal agreement she thrashed out with Brussels.But although Mrs May won the battle, she could still lose the war - with furious MPs warning they could block the deal when it reaches Parliament next month.The PM faces a mighty showdown with her own backbenchers and the DUP - starting with a crunch meeting with chief unionist Arlene Foster due to take place tonight.Tory Brexiteers have even threatened to bring Mrs May down for good by forcing a vote of confidence in her leadership.Even half of the Cabinet spoke out against the deal before reluctantly agreeing to sign off on it in a bid to avoid the Government collapsing altogether.As anger about the withdrawal agreement mounted this evening:The choices before us were dficult, particularly in relation to the Northern Ireland backstop.But the collective decision of Cabinet was that the Government should agree the draft withdrawal agreement and the outline political declaration.This is a decisive step which enables us to move on and finalise the deal in the days ahead.These decisions were not taken lightly but I believe it is a decision that is firmly in the national interest.Hinting at the trouble shes likely to face from rebellious MPs, Mrs May added: I know there will be dficult days ahead. This is a decision that will come under intense scrutiny and that is entirely as it should be and entirely understandable.She concluded: I believe that what I owe to this country is to take decisions in the national interest.I firmly believe with my head and my heart this is a decision which is in the best interests of our entire United Kingdom.Mrs May insisted that blocking her deal would mean going back to square one, with more ision and more uncertainty.And she promised to present the deal to Parliament tomorrow morning in a formal Commons statement.A number of pro-Brexit ministers were previously feared to be on the brink of walking out over the deal.Cabinet sources said  members of Mrs Mays top team were critical of the deal but were won over by fears that it was this or Jeremy Corbyn.Michael Gove was the only Brexiteer to speak in positive terms about the deal, but only Esther McVey seemed on the brink by the end of the meeting.Insiders said the Pensions Secretary was very emotional and some colleagues considered her behaviour aggressive toward the PM.She demanded a formal vote was taken and recorded in official minutes, and was very unhappy when Mrs May rebuffed her idea.Meanwhile Penny Mordant repeated her pleas for Ministers to be released from collective responsibility and given a free vote on the deal in the Commons.Mrs May moved to sooth Liam Foxs fears that trade deals will not be able to done with other countries for years to come, but sources said Jeremy Hunt and Sajid Javid were less convinced and not as gullible.Within minutes of Mrs May revealing the deal had made it through the Cabinet, Jacob Rees-Mogg called on Brexiteer MPs to vote against it when it comes to the Commons.He wrote in an open letter: The proposed agreement will see the UK hand over £billion to the EU for little or nothing in .The deal is unacceptable to unionists, will lock us into an EU customs union and EU laws and is profoundly undemocratic.Mr Rees-Mogg added: For these reasons I cannot support the proposed agreement in Parliament and would hope that Conservative MPs would do likewise.Mark Francois, a senior member of the pro-Brexit European Research Group, warned Mrs May the deal could bring her time in office to an end.He blasted: A lot of colleagues are very unhappy with this deal. I would rule nothing out.Tory MP Andrea Jenkyns said she was dismayed and disgusted, adding: The only way to save Brexit is a new leader.Nadine Dorries said: The Cabinet backing this deal is the quickest route to a leadership election.And Nigel Farage tweeted: Any cabinet member who is a genuine Brexiteer must now resign or never be trusted again, this is the worst deal in history.During Prime Ministers Questions this afternoon, the PM was assailed from all sides over her Brexit plans.Jeremy Corbyn blasted: After two years of bungled negotiations, from what we know of the Governments deal its a failure in its own terms.Tory Brexiteer Peter Bone told Mrs May: You are not delivering the Brexit people voted for and today you will lose the support of many Conservative MPs and millions of voters across the country.And Ken Clarke called on her to put Parliament first by keeping MPs in the loop - instead of hatching agreements behind closed doors.Last night Cabinet ministers were called into Downing Street one by one to examine the details of the agreement.NEXT FEW DAYS: EU diplomats study the text of the deal and flag up any problemsLATE NOVEMBER OR EARLY DECEMBER: EU leaders attend an emergency summit in Brussels, probably on November , where all  heads of government will sign off on the treatyBEFORE CHRISTMAS: Parliament votes on the withdrawal agreement - PM faces moment of truth as she attempts to head off Brexiteer rebellionFEBRUARY : The European Parliament holds its own vote on the dealMARCH , : The UK officially leaves the EU - but nothing will changethe withdrawal agreement has been confirmed, because it will include a -month transition periodEARLY : Talks begin in earnest on the final trade deal which will govern the future relationship between Britain and the EUDECEMBER , : The transition period ends, and Britain leaves the European single market and customs unionIrish PM Leo Varadkar earlier revealed an emergency EU summit was likely to take place on November  - just  days from now.He told the Dail: Should the UK Cabinet be in the position this afternoon to say its content with the text, it is proposed that the commission taskforce would be in a position perhaps tonight to publish the text with the possibility or probability of an EU Council meeting around November .He insisted the deal would safeguard the Good Friday Agreement and vowed to safeguard the rights of unionists in Northern Ireland.

title: would the brexit deal hammered out by theresa may leave us under control of the eu
story: They claim the withdrawal agreement will make Britain a vassal state of the EU because it will force us to follow European rules permanently.But Mrs May’s allies claimed last night that while the deal is not perfect, it was “the best anyone could get”, and she has pulled off some key wins.They include throwing out a Brussels bid to enforce a customs border down the Irish Sea, and an independent  to arbitrate overthe Irish border backstop should end when either side stops acting in good faith.The most contentious final area of the deal is the backstop plan to keep the Irish border wide openno trade deal can be agreed before the -month transition ends.Talks have been deadlocked for weeks over it.But a breakthrough to solve the impasse has seen British wins including a UK-wide customs backstop only.The EU has agreed to strike its bid for a second backstop for Northern Ireland only to keep it alone within the customs union.There will be more dferences in regulations for the province – which will infuriate the DUP.But No sources insist movement of goods from Northern Ireland to the UK will continue unchecked without any barriers, as today.There will be no way for Britain to unilaterally end the backstop.But London will be able to trigger the clause – known in legalese as “best endeavours” –it feels Brussels has stop negotiating a trade deal in good faith and is just trying to trap the UK inside a never-ending customs union.An independent  will arbitrate over the good faith mechanism.Details are still to be confirmed, but it is likely to be a  of five - two from the EU, two from the UK and one from a separate country.Leaks of the draft text pointed to Britain being asked to swallow being bound tightly to EU rules for years to come - with some oversight by EU judges as a consequence.One Brussels insider told the FT that the dferent rules for Northern Ireland were still contained in the document but “disappeared from view”.But in order to secure a UK wide customs backstop the Government will be forced to sign up strict EU rules on state aid for companies and so called “level playing field” rules.TODAY: Cabinet meeting takes place at pm where the PM will ask her key allies to approve the agreement - the deal is likely to be published in full afterwardsNEXT FEW DAYS: EU diplomats study the text of the deal and flag up any problemsLATE NOVEMBER OR EARLY DECEMBER: EU leaders attend an emergency summit in Brussels where all  heads of government will sign off on the treatyBEFORE CHRISTMAS: Parliament votes on the withdrawal agreement - PM faces moment of truth as she attempts to head off Brexiteer rebellionFEBRUARY : The European Parliament holds its own vote on the dealMARCH , : The UK officially leaves the EU - but nothing will changethe withdrawal agreement has been arranged, because it will include a -month transition periodEARLY : Talks begin in earnest on the final trade deal which will govern the future relationship between Britain and the EUDECEMBER , : The transition period ends, and Britain leaves the European single market and customs unionApart from the backstop, most details of the withdrawal agreement have been known for several months already.It will see a transition period extending until December , .During that time the UK will continue to act asit is still in the EU, following all European rules and remaining in the customs union.The deal also includes an agreement for Britain to pay out £billion, to cover the costs we have already agreed to cover.And it will guarantee the rights of Europeans living in the UK, plus Brits in the EU - meaning they can carry on under the current arrangements for their whole lives.The deal cut this week will give few details of future trade arrangements post Brexit.The trade deal will be negotiated over the next two years - throwing up yet more potential headaches for the Government eventhe withdrawal agreement passes without a hitch.

title: no deal brexit would cost every british family 6000 experts claim in boost for pm
story: In a boost for Theresa Mays hopes of getting her Brexit deal past Parliament, the International Monetary Fund issued a dire warning about the consequences of No Deal.The IMF said crashing out would slash Britains economy by up to  per cent compared to the status quo.That is the equivalent of economic growth slowing to a halt for four years or more.The IMF report came less than  hours after Mrs May revealed she has thrashed out a Brexit deal with Brussels.She could face a struggle getting the deal approved by MPs - butthey are terried of a No Deal outcome they may be more likely to back it.The IMF said thatBritain left the EU without a deal, reverting to World Trade Organisation rules, the economy would end up  to  per cent smaller than it would otherwise be.Under Mrs Mays Chequers plan, where Britain would keep EU regulations on goods, the economy would fall by around  per cent.The worst hit industries would include financial services, chemicals and car makers, according to the IMF.But other businesses such as mining, agriculture and food processing could all grow after Brexit.The forecasts compare the effects of Brexit to the status quo where Britain remains a member.It doesnt mean the economy would necessarily be plunged into recession - it could keep growing, but more slowly than before.Economic forecasts about Brexit issued before the referendum have proven far too pessimistic.

title: tony blair claims eurocrats gloated to him about defeating britain during brexit talks
story: The pro-Brussels ex-PM triggered further uproar by heaping praise on Theresa May’s Brexit guru Olly Robbins for hoodwinking the Cabinet.He said the top civil servant had “camouflaged” the grim terms of her deal as he urged MPs to strike it down and usher in a second referendum.In an incendiary intervention, the former premier warned that Brussels would seek to keep the UK in the customs union “until we let you out”.Smiling at a speech in Central London, he said: “By the way, talk to any of the EU officials privately they say Britain has basically caved in.“They are also basically saying once you get the other side of this March , they are going say you guys have agreed that you are in this customs union until we let you out - whatever they say before then, after because that is what they believe.”Mr Blair sparked controversy in July for holding private meetings with EU chief negotiator Michel Barnier, but would not be drawn on the identity of the gloating Eurocrat.Last night Jacob Rees-Mogg hit out: “That Blair backs boasting Brussels shows their success and Government’s failure.”The Brexiteer ringleader added: “He understands how spin works so his analysis is illuminating.The row came as Mr Blair savaged Mrs May’s Brexit deal, saying it amounted to capitulation to the European Union.He urged Labour MPs to reject the deal and back a second referendum, hitting out at Jeremy Corbyns abject refusal to lead the country out of the Brexit nightmare.Mr Blair said he had some sympathy with the Prime Minister who was faced with an impossible circle to square in keeping a frictionless border with Ireland but extracting the UK from the single market and customs union.But he said: Nothing can disguise the nature of the deal she has chosen,reports of it are true.This deal isnt a compromise, its a capitulation.The withdrawal agreement will keep us tied to EU trade policy until there is an end established by joint consent - in other words, the EU has a veto.It is coated in heavy fudge, but that is the inedible biscuit beneath the coating.He added that the proposals had united him and Boris Johnson in unholy alliance, adding: We agree this is a pointless Brexit in name only which is not the best of a bad job but the worst of both worlds.In the cause of taking back control we lose the control we had.Mr Blair highlighted the PowerPoint presentation used to promote Mrs May’s Chequers plan, claiming that the Prime Ministers Europe adviser Olly Robbins and the civil service had used “elaborate camouflage” to disguise elements of the proposals.He said: “I take my hat off to Olly Robbins, Olly is a very skilled guy, the elaborate camouflage of all the dferent points is a tribute to the skills of the British civil service, I say that sincerely.”

title: schoolgirls given free tampons nottingham period poverty
story: City Councils in Nottingham and Bristol have voted to provide free products in schools to ensure pupils do not miss out on their education during periods.Notts and Bristol have also said they will also aim to encourage local businesses to provide sanitary products for staff.The move is a response to statistics that show some women are being forced to choose between paying the bills and buying tampons, while schoolgirls have missed school because they couldnt afford sanitary products.In Nottingham, the motion was put forward by Labour councillor Nick Raine after speaking to teachers on his ward.He said: It affects pupils education. A total of  per cent of young women say they have missed at least one day of school because they didnt have adequate sanitary protection, and some have missed more.He continued: Well work with schools and colleges so they dont need to miss school.As a council, this in our power to address. And it was about time, in terms of equality, to discuss these matters in public.In Bristol, Councillor Helen Godwin, who lobbied for the motion, said: This issue simply shouldnt belong in  and it is a travesty that we need to tackle period poverty in our city. Too many of our girls and women are unable to afford or access sanitary protection during their period.Godwin said she wants Bristol to be a trailblazer local authority in how they tackle the issue and will hold a period poverty summit next month to map out how to ensure that all girls in Bristol for Year Five to  can access pads and tampons in their school.She said they will also pledge to ensure that free sanitary products will be available from libraries and civic buildings, as well as encouraging local businesses to provide products to their workforce.It is my hope then that women and girls will never have to consider whether they can afford to have their period, she said.Charity Plan International UK has found that one in  girls aged  to  have been unable to afford sanitary products.A total of  per cent have had to improvise sanitary wear and  per cent of girls have changed to a less suitable sanitary product due to cost.Lucy Russell, Plan International UKs Campaign Manager, said: We welcome proposals and new ideas to help tackle the fact that for too many girls, dealing with their period each month is proving a tough challenge. Distributing products at school, including reusables, could play a role in ensuring that no girl struggles to afford sanitary wear.”

story: Following the concert, Jessie J, , wrote in an Instagram Story post: "My heart is possibly the fullest its ever been walking off stage. No place like home. Thank you."It comes after the singer offered similar support for Tatum as Magic Mike Live, which he is co-directing, opened in London.

title: every minister who has resigns from theresa mays government over brexit so far
story: Proving that Brexit can ide families just as much as the rest of politics, Jo Johnson, brother of Brexit campaigner Boris Johnson, quit as a transport minister on Friday.He warned the UK was "barrelling towards an incoherent" orce and called for another referendum on the final terms of Brexit.A Remain-supporting minister in Orpington, where a majority of people voted to Leave in the  poll, Mr Johnson attacked the draft agreement for being "so radically dferent to what was proposed in the referendum campaign".:: David Davis, Brexit secretary Having led the UKs Brexit strategy from the beginning, David Davis announced he was standing down in July over the PMs Chequers proposal.The plan for the UKs future relationship with Brussels angered many Brexiteers.In quitting, Mr Davis, a veteran Tory MP, said he feared the UKs "negotiating approach" would only result in "further demands for concessions" from the EU.:: Boris Johnson, foreign secretary One of the biggest figures of the Brexit campaign, Boris Johnson also quit as foreign secretary over the Chequers proposal.

title: frightened rohingya flee refugee camps to avoid return to myanmar
story: Others are also in hiding - several of Husseins neighbours homes stand deserted, their terried inhabitants have disappeared.Bangladesh has promised all repatriations will be voluntary, but people say security has tightened in the camps over the last few days and theyre afraid of being forced back."Evenmy we is taken to Burma , I want to stay here," Hussein sobs. "Thats the place we were persecuted. They are still killing people there. So its better to die here, than going back and dying there."Only a small group remains on Husseins block in Jamtoli camp  people have already left.More than , Rohingya Muslims fled the brutal crackdown in Myanmar last year. They say soldiers and local Buddhists massacred families, burned hundreds of villages, and carried out gang rapes. title: huge asteroid crater found under the ice in greenland
story: It took almost two decades to identy the crater, with most of the data needed collected between  and , and the findings have now been detailed in a new paper for the latest edition of Science Advance.Co-author John Paden, a professor of electrical engineering and computer science at the University of Kansas, said: "Weve collected lots of radar-sounding data over the last couple of decades, and glaciologists put these radar-sounding data sets together to produce maps of what Greenland is like underneath the ice."Danish researchers were looking at the map and saw this big, crater-like depression under the ice sheet and looked at satellite imagery and - because the crater is on edge of the ice sheet - you can see a circular pattern there as well."The two combined made a really strong case for this being an impact-crater site." Based on the discovery, the catchily-named Multichannel Coherent Radar Depth Sounder- built for the university by the Alfred Wegener Institute in Germany - began its survey in May .

title: may looks to business for public support on brexit plan
story: He told Sky News: "It seems like we have a deal that is possible now, so lets get behind it - it will be much lower friction [than a no deal Brexit] and as a business we can make it work, so lets get on with it."That will be music to Mrs Mays ears.A key aspect of the Prime Ministers Chequers proposals, which would appear to be enshrined in the Brexit deal, was to ensure trade in goods between Britain and the EU remained as frictionless as possible after Britain leaves the EU.This is something for which many business leaders, particularly manufacturers, had been calling.So Mrs May and her advisers were disappointed that business leaders were not more supportive, in public, of the Chequers proposals. They regarded it as the most pro-Brexit measure her government has undertaken.Mrs May has had to work hard to build bridges with business. For her first two years in office, she gave the impression of not liking business much, while relations sank to a new low when in June Boris Johnson, the former Foreign Secretary, was reported as having said "f*** business".Things have begun to change in recent months though, particularly since Mrs May appointed the former investment banker William Vereker as her business envoy in July.Business leaders have enjoyed greater access to the Prime Minister and have been invited to take part in meetings and telephone conference calls with her.This included a meeting with  or so business leaders on Halloween at the Guildhall in the City of London, co-hosted by Philip Hammond, the Chancellor.Many attendees were struck by the confident tone the pair adopted around Brexit.This was followed by the creation of five business councils that are intended to meet three times a year, twice with Mrs May and once with a senior cabinet minister, with the aim of providing "high level advice and policy recommendations on the critical issues facing business".,targeting:" data-targeting-strnativekey"" data-targeting-"" data-tag"" data-component-name"sdc-site-mpu" aria-label"Advertisement" id"mpu-inline-mobile" data-tolerance""

title: brexit timetable what happens next
story: NewsBrexit timetable: What happens next now UK finally has a deal with the EU The UK faces a frenetic few weeks in a countdown that could topple Theresa May from power. Heres what happens nextShareCommentsByAndrew GregoryPolitical EditorDan BloomOnline Political Editor:,  NOV NewsShe has to overcome three hurdles - her Cabinet,  EU leaders, and a vote in the House of Commons"Get politics updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailThe UK finally has a draft Brexit deal with the EU, but Theresa May isnt out of the woods yet. She has to overcome three major hurdles - her own Cabinet,  EU leaders, and finally a vote in the House of Commons. At every stage she could be thwarted - especially the last one. MPs are threatening mutiny over the Northern Ireland backstop, a customs backup plan that could leave the UK trapped in Brussels orbit. After months of very little to report things could now move very quickly in a frenetic round of diplomacy. A lot is unknown, but here is the most likely timetable in the weeks and months ahead.  Tuesday  November : After months of stalled talks over the Northern Irish border, and  days after the Brexit vote, a deal was finally reached at a technical level between the UK and EU. Wednesday  November: Ministers flooded to an emergency Cabinet meeting from pm that ran for more than four hours to sign off the deal. This was the first of three danger moments for the PM, and ministers were ordered to either back the deal or quit. Thursday  November: Theresa May due to give a statement to Parliament on the -page Brexit deal, allowing MPs to finally question her for the first time. Sunday  November: This date has been pencilled in for an emergency EU summit with  other leaders to sign off the deal. This will be danger moment number two for the Prime Minister, when she has to face down pro-EU leaders like Emmanuel Macron and Angela Merkel. But its likely shell face more trouble at home than in Brussels, where EU officials have already spent months working out the detail. Thursday  December: The next scheduled European Council summit. This is the last chance saloon to agree a deal with the other EU leadersno emergency summit is scheduled. Already its much later than the ideal date, which was meant to be October. Otherwise there wont be time to sign it off before Brexit Day.  Thursday  December: By this date, there will be a vote in the UK Parliament on the deal. This is danger moment number three for Theresa May - and by far the worst one. If any of the crunch moments will force her from office, it will be this one. She will almost certainly have to resign or face a vote of no confidence. She claims the UK will leave with No Deal anywayshe loses. But Labour say she should be forced back to the negotiating table call a general election or even trigger a second EU referendum.  January to March : Dozens of national and regional parliaments across the EU will hold their own votes on the Brexit deal. Meanwhile, No Deal planning has to ramp up in case everything doesnt come together in time.  March : Brexit Day. If theres a deal, this will be a total anticlimax because a transition will be in place. If theres No Deal, planes could be grounded, ports jammed up and customs checks thrown into chaos at pm.   December : If theres a deal, this is when the transition period - which continues pretty much all the EU rules we have now - is supposed to end. Only at this point will the much-discussed Brexit deal actually kick in. Talk has been floated of extending this date by a few months. After December : If theres still no deal to stop customs checks on the Northern Ireland border, under current plans a backstop would kick in. This could keep the UK tied to EU customs rules, until a proper agreement is reached, in exchange for keeping the Northern Ireland border open. What happensa deal is voted down   If MPs do not vote for the PM’s deal then the UK defaults to a no-deal Brexit. Such a scenario could trigger a crisis in the financial markets, plummeting sterling and adding to an unprecedented political crisis. What then  Constitutionally, the Government must decide what happens next. Ministers have to come to Parliament by  January to make a statement setting out their proposals. Will the PM quit or face a leadership challengeshe loses the vote   Few Tory MPs seem happy with Mrs May’s leadership but important factors have somehow managed to keep her in power to date, and they haven’t changed. Tory MPs know they are likely to face voters’ anger and there is no agreed successor. If she resigns it could still be messy. Will there be an election  Theresa May would also have to lose an vote of confidence in the Commons in order for an election to occur. What is the latest stage at which a no-deal Brexit can be reversed   Some argue the only real deadline for a deal is  March . As long as a deal has been struck, and approved by Parliament in a meaningful vote by Brexit day, then Article  can be extended in order for the legislation to be passed. This could mean that evena deal was voted down the first time round it could be put in front of MPs again, possibly early next year. For more information read our guide to whats happening with the Brexit talks and  ways No Deal Brexit will affect your le.

story: NewsWill Theresa May win Brexit vote  How MPs voted in  - and where they are nowWeve crunched the numbers as Theresa May faces a House of Commons vote on Brexit - and looked at how wildly things are dferent since ShareCommentsByBen GlazeDeputy political editorDan BloomOnline Political Editor:,  NOV Updated:,  NOV News"Get politics updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailIts  days since the Brexit referendum, and the House of Commons is almost unrecognisable. David Cameron has been replaced with Theresa May. Once loyal ministers are revolting hard. And Jeremy Corbyn soldiers on. The biggest dference is that where once we had a clear iding line - Leave v Remain - we now swim through a treacle of warring factions. Hard Remain, Hard Brexit , loyalism and nervous backers. It can all be quite dficult to understand. And its going to prove crucial because, at some point in the next month, MPs are going to vote on Theresa Mays deal in the House of Commons. The factions are so complicated and so fast-moving that we genuinely dont know for sureshe will win. So weve put together a guide to how things went down then - and how theyre going down now.  When the numbers are crunched, it is clear that Mrs May will have her work cut out to convince enough MPs to support her EU exit strategy. Now that a draft deal has been agreed between the EU and UK, there are three hurdles to overcome. The first is Cabinet, the second is  EU leaders, and the third and hardest is the UK Parliament. Its the third bit were worried about here. MPs are grouped in several factions - their warring opinions on it all are explained in more detail here. Even though they disagree on the reasons why, they could band together and vote down the deal - defeating Theresa May.  Here are the factions and where they sit.  MPs would be enough to defeat the PM. TORY LOYALISTS: More than  are likely to vote with Theresa May, for the deal. Many have paid government jobs - so would have to quitthey oppose her. TORY BREXITEERS: One source rubbished claims  Tory MPs could oppose the deal. But they conceded “ to  of the swivel-eyed lot” could line up against the plan. This group fears a Britain trapped in vassalage with Brussels, and includes Boris Johnson and Jacob Rees-Mogg. TORY REMAINERS: Insiders believe up to  Tory Remainers could vote against the PM’s deal. They include former ministers Justine Greening, Jo Johnson and Phillip Lee. DUP: Theresa Mays Northern Irish allies - who she handed pound.bn - are -strong. They will vote down any deal that allows customs checks between Ulster and Britain. LABOUR LOYALISTS: About  MPs are consistently loyal to Jeremy Corbyn on Brexit. As things look now theyll vote against the deal because it wont meet Labours six tests for a good exit. LABOUR REMAINERS: There are about  hard Remainer Labour MPs. Theyre likely to oppose the deal to avoid enabling a Tory Brexit. NERVOUS LABOUR: Some Labour MPs could BACK a deal - fearing otherwise Britain will be plunged into an even worse No Deal. There could be  or more. Caroline Flint is among them. LABOUR BREXITEERS: There are only about half a dozen. It was generally thought theyd side with Theresa May, but Kate Hoey MP broke ranks and said she could vote against. Westminster sources have drawn up an “inner list” of Brexit-supporting Labour MPs they believe will back the PM. But it has just two names on it. OTHERS: The SNP , Lib Dems , Plaid Cymruand Greensare all likely to vote against. Eight Independent MPs sit in the Commons, though seven were elected for parties before either quitting their respective whips or having it withdrawn. Of those, three, possibly four, would back the PM, with another likely to vote against the deal because it does not deliver a hard enough Brexit.

This years jungle reality show is on-course to be a fun-free retread, carefully read off the autocue with no ad-libbing by Holly Willoughbubbly and a sleep-deprived dad. But oh, how much better it would bethe producers had the wit, foresight and sense of public service to centre the whole thing on Brexit. There would be two benefits:  So much voting  If we cant make some of those responsible eat kangaroo testicles while we watch, then the nation will otherwise block out the most important consitutional event in our letimes As a happy bonus, Nigel Farage might explode. Whats not to like  There are many ways the producers could achieve a much better Im A Celebrity. For example: . Drop entire Cabinet into jungle via parachute packed by Edward Scissorhands . Realise this means Mogg is in charge, so send rest of Conservative Party as new campmate with secret mission to actually support the Cabinet infor knighthoods . Microchip the inmates, deny them access to sugary drinks, WhatsApp conspiracy groups, and the newspaper articles of Boris Johnson  . Order Ant McPartlin to narrate, without his lawyer or PR man, and having told him his we got the dog . Send in Nigel Farage, Arron Banks and any suspicious-looking Russian friends . Use TVs The Hunted team to track down all others loosely responsible for getting us into this mess, and send them to the camp via Hermes most devil-may-care service . Nuke the site from orbit. Its the only way to be sure And wouldnt the peace be wonderful - the silence of the Johnsons, the restoration of sanity, the knowledge wed never have to see Theresa May dance again. Perhaps Laura Kuenssberg and her colleagues could get on with covering everything  thats been screwed up. Perhaps we could elect some people to Parliament with a vague idea of how to fix things rather than making them worse. Maybe, even, wed have a moment of national clarity and notice that Brexit was an expression of unhappiness that cannot be followed through without wrecking everything, so best pretend it never happened and invite the French over for Christmas. So much better, more entertaining, and more cathartic for our current sickness of slathering self-hatred to focus it, for a few short weeks, onto those we deem responsible, bury them alive in coffins filled with snakes and spiders, and move into the new year freshly filled with joy. story: NewsTory Peter Bone savages Mays Brexit deal that will lose millions of votesThe Brexiteer once said Theresa May could be the Queen of Brexit - but has changed his tuneShareCommentsByTom DavidsonOnline Reporter:,  NOV Updated:,  NOV NewsPeter Bone savaged the Brexit deal on offer"Get politics updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailPeter Bone today led Tory outrage at Theresa Mays Brexit deal - saying it does not deliver the Brexit people voted for. The Brexiteer MP confronted the Prime Minister to her face with a damning assessment of the deal her Cabinet will decide on this afternoon. Mr Bone MP told Theresa May during Prime Ministers Questions: “Is the Prime Minister aware thatreports are accurate you are not delivering the Brexit people voted for and today you will lose the support of many Conservative MPs and millions of voters across the country.” The Prime Minister backed the deal on offer and said it delivered on the result of the  referendum. The Tory had MP had previously been supportive of Mays negotiations with the EU and said she could be the Queen of Brexit.  It comes as dozens of hard Brexiteer Tories from the European Research Group prepare to vote against the deal in the House of Commons. The small clutch of Remain-backing Tories could vote against it too. Fellow Tory Phillip Lee, who supports the anti-Brexit group Best for Britain and resigned in protest at Brexit, agreed with Mr Bone. He said: Where we’re going to end up is not where was promised. This is political fraud, and I’m not putting my name to it. A Brexit deal between the UK and EU is set to be agreed. The final hurdle will be a vote in Parliament. MPs are grouped in several factions - their warring opinions on it all are explained here. Even though they disagree,they all vote down the deal they could defeat Theresa May. Here are the groups and where they sit. Remember,  or so votes would be enough to defeat the PM. TORY LOYALISTS: More than  are likely to vote with Theresa May, for the deal. Many have paid government jobs - so would have to quitthey oppose her. TORY BREXITEERS: There are up to  or , whove warned they will vote down any deal that leaves Britain trapped in vassalage with Brussels. They include Boris Johnson and Jacob Rees-Mogg. TORY REMAINERS: This group is much smaller, up to perhaps a dozen. Some including Justine Greening and Jo Johnson have vowed to oppose the deal, instead wanting a second referendum. DUP: Theresa Mays Northern Irish allies - who she handed pound.bn - are -strong. They will vote down any deal that allows customs checks between Ulster and Britain. LABOUR LOYALISTS: About  MPs are consistently loyal to Jeremy Corbyn on Brexit. As things look now theyll vote against the deal because it wont meet Labours six tests for a good exit. LABOUR REMAINERS: There are about  hard Remainer Labour MPs. Theyre likely to oppose the deal to avoid enabling a Tory Brexit. NERVOUS LABOUR: Some Labour MPs could BACK a deal - fearing otherwise Britain will be plunged into an even worse No Deal. There could be  or more. Caroline Flint is among them. LABOUR BREXITEERS: There are only about half a dozen. It was generally thought theyd side with Theresa May, but Kate Hoey MP broke ranks and said she could vote against. OTHERS: The SNP , Lib Dems , Plaid Cymruand Greensare all likely to vote against.  If the public, having read the deal, having understood that Northern Ireland is going to be treated dferently, having understood that we’re going to be taking the obligations but not the benefits of EU membership. If they understand all that and vote for it, then I’m a democrat and I’ll respect that. None of that appeared on the side of a bus in . Bone had an unlikely ally in Jeremy Corbyn who likewise attacked the deal.Mr Corbyn - who himself supports staying in a customs union with the EU - said the “bungled” deal was a “failure on its own terms” after “two years of bungled negotiations”.

title: brave couple pick gale lashed
story: NewsBrave US couple pick gale-lashed Hebrides mountain for incredible wedding photosJames and Laura Mortier eloped from Chicago to the Isle of Skye for the amazing photo shoot, with the brides white dress soaked and covered in mudShareCommentsByDaniel Sheridan:,  NOV Updated:,  NOV NewsThese incredible photographs show a wedding photo shoot with a dference "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA daring US couple eloped to a gale-lashed mountain in Scotland for an incredible set of wedding photos.James and Laura Mortier wanted the snaps of their special day to be dferent but they were in shock at how strong the winds were.The photographs capture the bride traipsing through muddy bogs in her stunning white wedding dress and with her bridal hair whipped up by gale force winds. And the groom is captured in the stark landscape, his neatly tailored wedding suit soaked through by sheets of rain lashing the crags. But the results of their bold choice of venue are a series of stunning images that capture both the raw beauty of the wilderness setting and their love for each other.  Newly-weds James and Laura picked the Isle of Skye after considering locations around the globe. James, , and Lisa,  flew from their home in Chicago to the picturesque island for the unique shoot following their Scottish wedding ceremony on September .The couple, who have been together for four years, got in touch with Andrew Rae - a Scottish photographer - on Instagram after viewing his incredible gallery of past images.However, the pair were hit with strong winds and a barrage of mud as they posed for the set.  Lisa said: We anticipated cooler, misty, weather similar to that of the Pacic Northwest in the states. Boy, were we in for a surprise. The wind was unreal. The weather in Chicago fluctuates pretty regularly in spring and fall. We could have a week of F and have snow the next. We have a fair amount of wind that comes off of Lake Michigan, but nothing like the wind in Skye. I’m sure it was F and sunny back home on our wedding day.  Lisa said the couple took a while to decide on their perfect destination to elope but after spotting pictures of the Isle, their mind was made up. Lisa added: We wanted a unique wedding experience that was reflective of us. We both love the outdoors and are always up for an adventure. We were interested in a remote area overseas, the idea just seemed more romantic.  She added: Our first destination thought was French countryside, but the more I researched it, the more dficult it seemed to be due to the language barrier. Scotland continually came up as an elopement destination and neither of us had been before so we just kind of went with it. Photographs of Skye really solidied it as the perfect place for us.  The couple prepared for the weather conditions and Lisa said she didnt mind getting her wedding dress covered in mud. She added: It was expected. I searched for the perfect dress that could pack well and was lightweight for hiking around for this purpose. We wanted to end up in the fairy pools, but due to the weather we never made it. I’ve been dreaming of Skye every day since.  The newlyweds grew up just half a mile away from each other Lisa said: We knew of each other in high school but connected well after college at a neighbourhood bar. We now own a home in the same neighborhood we grew up in.  Lisa said she would recommend a similar shoot to anyone who wants incredible wedding photographs. She added: We planned to marry at Loch Coruisk but could not make the trip due to bad weather. We chose to marry at Honeycomb Rock, an area near the pier to travel to Loch Coruisk. Andrew’s photography skills are truly an art form. I never imagined I would look at such a beautul photograph and see myself in it.  We had such a wonderful experience, everyone was so warm and welcoming. The people really made the trip. For those interested, expect the worst with the weather and embrace it. And please, leave Skye as beautul as you found it.

title: mum three left unable afford
story: NewsMum-of-three left unable to afford electricity after being charged twice for her Asda shopJenna Lee-McCaffrey said she was left worrying about how she would afford to pay for her sons first birthday and Christening after the incident at the store in Pontprennau, CardfShareCommentsByAnna Lewis:,  NOV NewsJenna Lee-McCaffrey from Rumney with her children Harrison, nine, Lawson, one, and Emmie, seven "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA mum-of-three was left unable to afford electricity after being charged twice for her weekly shop. Jenna Lee-McCaffrey, , said she worried how she would pay for her sons first birthday and Christening after she was allegedly left out of pocket. The mum says she eventually got the money back but it was eight days after her food shop. She claims her family was left without electricity on Sunday because of how long it took to have the money ed to her account. The error on her bank account occurred after she went food shopping at the Asda in Pontprennau, Cardf last Tuesday, Wales Online reports. Jenna claims she was told her card payment for her pound. food bill had been declined.But after her card was charged for a second time she found two payments had been taken, she claims.  Jenna, from Rumney, said: The second payment went through so I went to my car and just thought I would check. The first payment had gone out and and the second was still pending to leave my bank account. I told the lady on customer services and she said as the pending payment was floating it would take three to five working days to get it back. On Sunday, Jenna and her family were left without electricity due to the time it took for the money to be put back into her account. As a result, she said she has had to throw out a full freezer of food that defrosted as a result. She said: My electric went off because I was pound down which would have saw me over to this week. I went shopping last Tuesday and paid my gas and electricity which was pound each. That was supposed to last me until Friday or Saturday but luckily it went until Sunday. On Sunday evening we had to sit in the dark. I had to get them ready for school without ironing their unorm because I had no electricity. I had to go up there on Monday and was there two hours trying to get something. I came away with pound just to be able to get something my kids for tea. I spoke to three managers and they said there was nothing they could do. There was absolutely no sympathy - I had my young baby with me.  Jenna says the time it took to get the money back caused her to worry about her youngest sons first birthday. She said: Its my sons first birthday this Sunday and its his Christening so Im finding it dficult to pay for anything. I dont get any child benefits for him as he was born after the third child barrier so everything I get for him I have to work for. This sent me over the edge. I was in tears over it. My family shouldnt be seeing me stressed because of all of this. Im not looking to gain anything from this or an extra shop, I just wanted it to be dealt with in a compassionate way. Jenna said the money was ed to her account on Wednesday morning, eight days after her food shop. She said: When I went up, there was another lady there having the same problem. This could have happened to an elderly person or a single mother using her last pound to buy her baby some food. An Asda spokesperson said: “We would like to apologise to Ms Lee-McCaffrey and her family for the inconvenience caused. We are glad her money was refunded by the relevant service provider and that she accepted a gesture of goodwill from us.”

title: over 400 people form vigilante
story: NewsMore than  people form vigilante group to tackle crime in lawless BritainBirmingham residents formed We Stand Determined after becoming fed up with anti-social behaviour and deciding to act as a second line of defence for the communityShareCommentsByNeil MurphyDan Coles:,  NOV Updated:,  NOV NewsTwo organisers of the We Stand Determined group "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailConcerned residents have formed a vigilante group to tackle growing crime in their area after a spate of violent attacks. Nearly  locals have formed the group ‘We Stand Determined’ to report any dangers the Birmingham community may have faced. The group was put together on Facebook three weeks ago after an unsuccessful petition to get more police in the area. Organisers Wayne, Tracy and Michael founded the group after discovering a friend had been attacked in his home by thieves armed with hammers. They now organise twice-weekly patrols across the city. The group insists it is non-violent and seeks to work in partnership with the police while acting as a new line of defence for the community.  Solihull-based college lecturer Wayne, , who does not wish to reveal his surname over fears for his safety, said: The way our group started, and the reaction we’ve had, has showed us how much local communities need groups like us to fill in the gaps the authorities simply don’t have the funding for. There has been a recent spate of crime in Birmingham recently and Solihull in particular has fallen victim to an increase of just under , more cases so far this year. People needed someone to turn to, someone who will listen and visit them in their homea constituent is fearful for their own safety. We’re vigilantes, but we’re vigilantes with a twist, working within the law and not against it. Our group is a central place for the local community to come together to log crimes, comment and help stop crime in the area.  Birmingham has recently been blighted by a wave of stabbings, shootings and murders. Also plaguing the city are Corsa Cannibals known for stripping down Vauxhall Corsas to sell the parts on. Tracy said We Stand Determined is not against West Midlands Police as they understand the force can only do what they can with the funding they are given. But the group say this doesnt solve the problem of reduced Bobbies on the beat. We Stand Determined says it has big plans to generate a totally new level of support in the area by organising buddy systems for the elderly and defence classes for anyone who feels they need to be able to protect themselves.  It soon hopes to grow bigger and have representatives based in every area of the country so Wayne, Tracy and Michael can help everyone sleep a little easier. Tracy, , said: We stress to our members thatthey see something, they should noty the police first. We would like to join up with the police, but we want to be able to make our own decisions on where the help is really needed, and not where the police tell us to be.  Wayne added: We hope to gather funding to support out future objectives, at the moment we are totally self-funded. I just want to make a big dference to the area, and help anyone, anywhere, who needs it. Crime here is getting out of hand. We’re so proud of our community, for standing up to what we believe is an ongoing issue that’s yet to have a solution. A spokesman for West Midlands Police said officers were aware of multiple groups but advised members to join police-approved Streetwatch programmes instead.

title: pregnant mum seven wants rehousing
story: NewsPregnant mum-of-seven wants rehousing from hellish four-bed council flatAlana Burns, from Livingston, West Lothian, is due to give birth to twins in MarchShareCommentsBySarah WardBradley Jolly:,  NOV Updated:,  NOV NewsAlana Burns has squeezed Alisha, two, Steven, four, Cayden, seven, Leigh, , and Caitlin, , in addition to her adult kids Stewart, , and Bryan, , into the flat "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA mum-of-seven pregnant with twins described living in a four-bedroom council flat as hell and has pleaded to be rehoused. Alana Burns, who is due to give birth in March, has crammed her kids Alisha, two, Steven, four, Cayden, seven, Leigh, , and Caitlin, , as well as adult children Stewart, , and Bryan, , in the flat above a pub. The family has squeezed into three of the four bedrooms as the fourth is uninhabitable due to a leak. Ms Burns said: My relationship with some of my children is at breaking point. The family was living in a private let in nearby Livingston until her landlord decided to sell the property in August. They spent a month in hotels before West Lothian Council found the Bathgate flat in September.  But Ms Burns added: Im feeling down every night and sometimes you just feel like giving up. But I just have to keep going for the sake of the kids. It is not safe for anyone to be sleeping in that room so were now down to eight people sharing three bedrooms which is ridiculous. Ms Burns says the flat, which does not have a television or room outside in which her children can play, also has uneven flooring, damaged ceilings, noisy neighbours and is not receiving post. story: NewsSecret Facebook group reveals how parents use bleach enemas on autistic children in bid to cure disabilityWARNING - GRAPHIC CONTENT: The woman was reported to cops after allegedly writing on a members-only forum for parents who believe autism is caused by parasitesShareCommentsBySophie NorrisLucy Clarke-Billings:,  AUG Updated:,  AUG Newsthis.style.displaynone" Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror lestyle video what-autism-national-autistic-society-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:,video.header.bidding.enabled:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:,video.header.bidding.enabled:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true""Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email A mum-of-three is being investigated by police and social services for allegedly using bleach enemas on her young son to cure his autism . The woman, from Cheshire, was reported to police after she appeared to write on a secret Facebook group that she had used the potentially lethal treatment on her son.The highly-covert group is for parents who believe autism - a lelong, developmental disability - is caused by parasites. The groups , members, who are allegedly charged pound to join, share images of the so-called parasites leaving their children after treatment while congratulating themselves. But autism campaigner Emma Dalmayne claims the shocking images in fact show childrens bowel linings that have been burned out of their bodies by the bleach.  The treatment, known as CDor MMS , is administered orally or via enema and is being sold in the UK by online dealers and in person. Emma infiltrated the Facebook group and discovered the mother from Cheshire appearing to confess to using CD on her young son and reported her to Cheshire Police. Posts from the mum appear to show her admitting to administering  drops a day to her son, but becoming worried when he seemed weak and wouldnt get out of bed. Emma is calling for the government to ban the treatments and has launched at petition calling for alleged autism cures to be made illegal, which has more than , signatures.  Emma, an autistic mum-of-six from London, said: No parents will admit to doing this to their children publicly. This treatment is not illegal at the moment but we need to get rid of it. These parents are so ashamed of doing it in the first place. These people are brainwashed by [proponents of CD and MMS], who say that those against this support big pharma. The biggest problem is that the government dont do anything about this. This is not illegal yet. It is not illegal to use CD on your children and it needs to be. The most extreme case I have seen to date is a six-year-old boy who had to have his bowel removed and a colostomy bag fitted after his parents gave him these enemas. What you see in these images is the bowel lining of these victims. Some of the people who disagree with my campaigning have told me I should die, Im a whore, my children are vaccine damaged, I wont heal them because I want them to be autistic and I claim disability allowance so it wouldnt be profitable to heal them. It makes me so angry as an autistic person. Im furious that people want to heal this. There is no cure for autism. It isnt a disease or a disorder, its a neurological dference.  The Food Standards Agency issued a warning that both MMS and CD should be avoided and that the concentration of MMS is equivalent to industrial strength bleach. The mother, whose son is severely autistic, refused to respond to attempts to speak to her. A spokesperson from Cheshire Police said: This is an ongoing incident and we are investigating whether any criminal offences have taken place. Another parent, from Leicestershire, who claimed on the group that she had used MMS on her baby daughter, asked the group membersshe was doing alright because the baby was OK. The woman and her husband, both originally from Algeria, claimed they did not want to comment and had noticed how opinions y about this treatment. Her husband said: She is not happy to talk about. We are not there yet. I therefore have nothing  to say.  On the Facebook group, there is advice on how to make protocol , testimonials and also safe online practices information. Guidelines on the group that were published in  advise members that use of CD is beyond the mainstream standard of care and can get you into trouble. It also saystherapists, nurses or school officials come to your home please keep your supplies and dosing discreet. Recent posts from the website show concerned parents listing abnormal symptoms after administering CD to their autistic children. One mother posted: Hi everybody, my son has the last few days blue lips, is that normal . Others respond saying no, that is not normal. Check his heart. The concerned mother replied Im worried now. What can it be  But it started after we used CD.  On July , another parent posted a graphic image of her daughters dirty nappy with long pieces of bowel lining laid out on a piece of kitchen roll. The mother asks members to identy what parasite it is, and one respondent claims her daughter must be doing bettershe expelled this without even an enema. An admin posted this is good. Keep doing enemas to pull them out. On July , a member posted a picture of a parasite she had expelled dangling from a fork - though Emma believes it is cm of a childs bowel lining. Along with the Facebook group, Genesis II church also advertises the use of MMS on their website and lists sellers of the treatment. The organisation has  churches worldwide, including one in London and Co. Kildare, Ireland. It offers a ten-day course for members to train as MMS doctors or ministers, after which they could be able to open their own church. Once the ministers have healed  people, they will be given a doctorate degree. It also includes details about how it not only cures autism, but cancer, dementia, HIV, tumours and genital warts. Holistic therapist Danielle Bryant, from Wales, was warned repeatedly by the Food Standards Authorityand Medical and Healthcare Products Regulatory Agencylast month thatMMS was not deleted from her website it would be closed down. She admits that she was a health minister for the Genesis II church after attending one of their courses on how to make MMS, but claims she only ever used it on herself. Danielle said: Ive never really sold it. I have only ever made it for myself. I put the MMS on my website, but I never had any takers. The FSA contacted me to say they would take down my websiteI didnt take down [the link for MMS. I used MMS for a few things and that was quite a few years ago. Id read about it and I had a positive outcome. I just did the [Genesis II] course around six years ago.

story: NewsChris Watts parents reveal why they want him to take BACK murder confessionRonnie and Cindy Watts claim their son was "railroaded" into confessing to murdering his pregnant we and their two young daughtersShareCommentsBySophie Evans:,  NOV NewsChris Watts has admitted murdering his pregnant we Shanann, , and their two young daughters, Bella and Celeste "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailChris Wattss parents want him to take back his murder confession, claiming he was railroaded into a plea deal to avoid the death penalty.Speaking out for the first time about their sons case, Cindy and Ronnie Watts insisted he isnt a sociopath and they want to find out the truth. Appearing in a televised interview, an emotional Cindy said she was desperate for Watts to fight, adding: I want him to not take this plea deal. She also said theres no telling what will be done to her son in prison.Last week, Watts wore a bulletproof vest as he pleaded guilty to the nine charges against him at a court in Colorado, US.These charges included the murders of his pregnant we Shanann, , and their two daughters, Bella, four, and three-year-old Celeste. But Cindy doesnt believe her son killed the two girls. Instead, she considers his story that he killed Shanann after discovering she had strangled their children to death to be true. Watts has previously claimed that he strangled his expecting we in a rage after realising she had killed the youngsters.“I know he confessed, but he was railroaded into it,” his mother, of Spring Lake, North Carolina, told the Denver Post. She added: I want him to take back the plea deal. Cindy believes her sons public defenders were solely focused on saving him from a potential death sentence when he struck the plea deal.In an interview with Denver , she said the focus was to save his le.Save his le and le in prison - to me there’s no dference, she said.  He’s going to die in prison.... I just want him to fight. I want him to not take this plea deal. I want him to plead not guilty to the children. Ronnie, meanwhile, told the news station that there remains a whole lot of unanswered questions about the case, which has shocked the world. The father added: I just want to make sure hes doing the right thing. If he didnt kill the children, I want him to face that and let them prove it. The parents have claimed they repeatedly tried to speak alone with their son, but that they were prevented from doing so by his attorneys.At one point, Cindy reportedly told her son: You did not do this. She told him not to confess, but claims attorneys quickly shut down the conversation.In a statement responding to the Watts familys claims, Shananns parents said Watts pleaded guilty to murdering his family because he is guilty.  They added: Their  statements, however hurtful and inaccurate, will never alter the truth about Shanann and will never alter the truth about the crimes committed by their son.Her memory and reputation deserves to be protected. And her family is fully prepared to do so.Shanann, a faithful we and loving mum, was  weeks pregnant with a son she was going to name Nico when she was slaughtered by her husband. The killings took place on either August  or . Watts buried Shanann in a shallow grave and stuffed their daughters bodies in oil tanks where he worked, officials have said. The bodies were discovered days after the trio were reported missing from their home in Frederick, Colorado. It has been widely reported Watts strangled them to death, but this has never been confirmed.  Last week, Shananns family sat in the courtrooms front row as they listened to Watts enter his pleas, the Denver Channel reported. The killer wore a bulletproof vest as he admitted to nine charges. They were: three counts of first-degree murder after deliberation, two counts of first-degree murder – victim under  position of trust, one count of first-degree unlawful termination of a pregnancy, and three counts of tampering with a deceased human body. Watts is now facing le behind bars without the possibility of parole. He will be sentenced on November . After Shanann, Bella and Celeste vanished three months ago, the murderer made a tearful TV plea to find them.Days later, on August , he was arrested but denied he had killed them.  However, he began repeatedly changing his story to police. He claimed that his we had strangled their daughters in revenge after he revealed he was having an affair and wanted to split. He allegedly told detectives that he flew into a rage and strangled Shanann after catching her in the act on a baby monitor screen. But police rejected Wattss story and charged him with three counts of first-degree murder. Bella and Celestes bodies were found on the property of Anadarko Petroleum, one of Colorados largest oil and gas drillers. Shanann was discovered dead in a shallow grave nearby. The mum had been initially reported missing after ing home from a business trip to Arizona at around am. Watts had spent the weekend at home with their children. He claimed he last saw his we at .am before he left for work.  Speaking on NBCs Today show, he said he and Shanann had had an emotional conversation that morning and had stayed up talking . However, he didnt give any further details. He said: I dont feel like this is even real right now. Its like a nightmare I cant wake up from. Watts allegedly eventually confessed to police after giving a number of interviews to national media. Police said he led officers to Shananns body. Ahead of Wattss guilty pleas last week, it had been reported that the killer was on suicide watch and was not doing well at all. A source told People: “The gravity of the situation has hit him like a ton of bricks. Depression is setting in, and he’s despondent.  Shanann and her daughters were laid to rest on September . In a moving tribute at their funeral service, the mums brother, Frankie Rzucek, said she had wanted a great le for her children. I always worried about her and the girls being so far, because I couldnt protect them, said Frankie. Meanwhile, a tribute from Shananns dad read: Daddy loves you. You are a wonderful daughter and a great mother. You are nothing but pure love, always caring fro everyone. You will always be Daddys little girl.

story: NewsCIA used truth serum on   suspect after waterboarding failedDocuments reveal that mind-altering substance called called Versed was administered to suspect Abu ZubaydahShareCommentsByChristopher Bucktin:,  NOV Updated:,  NOV NewsAbu Zubaydah"Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailNewly declassied documents show the CIA looked to use a “truth serum” for a suspected senior Al-Qaeda after they failed to break him with waterboarding.Desperate agents explored giving Abu Zubaydah - and several other alleged terrorists - the drug after believing he held vital information about possible future terror attacks. A newly released -page account details the existence of a drug research program called Project Medication and discloses how the CIAs Office of Medical Services maintained a key role in the development of detention and interrogation practices.  Specically, the papers, which were released after a y Freedom of Information battle, reveal agents researched the possibility of using a psychoactive drug called Versed to interrogate high-level prisoners. The history reveals that CIA doctors were hunting for a truth serum to use on prisoners as part of a previously secret effort called Project Medication, American Civil Liberties Union staff attorney Dror Ladin said in a statement. The lawyer added the records showed CIA doctors were indispensable to the effort of legitimizing the program.” Abu Zubaydahs capture in Pakistan in  prompted the CIA under President George W. Bush to create the interrogation program, now widely viewed as torture, in the  belief, he had information about Al-Qaeda he had not already provided to the FBI. The CIA believed he was one of the most senior figures in Al-Qaeda when he was captured. But Abu Zubaydah is now described in U.S. documents as a “well-known al-Qaeda facilitator.” His lawyers deny he was a member of the terrorist organisation. One said: Ok I lost  minutes of my le and yellowed my skin! Wow!!  Another commented: I also tried it but no results. A third wrote: Big fail. And to make matters worse an expert is now advising against the whole thing.Speaking to Cosmopolitan magazine, Mona Gohara, M.D. dermatologist at Yale University said: Toothpaste is a skin irritant - its meant for your teeth, not for your skin or hair.It may make a good paste, like how sugaring is a good paste for removing hair, but it can also be irritating and not that effective.

title: inside mr blobbys derelict house
story: NewsInside Mr Blobbys eerie abandoned Crinkley Bottom theme park left to rot after s BlobbymaniaNoel Edmonds pink sidekick once had a home at the centre of a s theme park Crinkley Bottom - left to rot years after it closedShareCommentsByNicola OakleyHead of Audience:,  NOV Updated:,  NOV NewsDunblobbin was once a bright and colourful home - and an incredibly popular tourist attraction "Get Im a Celebrity updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailMr Blobby is enjoying somewhat of a renaissance this week. His pal Noel Edmonds is rumoured to be heading into the jungle to star in this years series of Im a Celebrity, causing a wave of s nostalgia to sweep across the UK. And BBC political correspondent Chris Mason suggested Mr Blobby might have better luck in his job after admitting he hasnt got the foggiest clue what will happen with Brexit. He might not be very popular anymore, but big Mr Blobby fans might remember that he once had his own theme park. Crinkley Bottom, or Blobbyland opened in Cricket St Thomas, Somerset in  in the height of Blobbymania, when the pink spotty sidekick starred in Noel Edmonds House Party.  It closed down five years later, but its buildings remained on the site, abandoned and standing eerily empty until explorers discovered Mr Blobbys derelict house in .Their pictures and videos went viral as people reminisced about their family holidays in the s - and so many people broke in to explore the house that it was eventually demolished in . A map of the Crinkley Bottom theme park shows a railway, an Animals of Farthing Wood attraction alongside sea lion shows, a safari ride, fun village, a deer park and leopards.There was also a TVs family favourites attraction and a high street featuring the Blobby Shop.  But the main pull of the park for s kids was, of course, Mr Blobbys house. Dunblobbin, painted bright pink with yellow spots and a blue roof, was surrounded by a white picket fence and had windowsills adorned with blooming plastic flowers.Next to its iconic front door, where everyone wanted their photo taken, was a doorbell which could be pressed to hear the familiar shrill cry of Blobby blobby blobby! According to the unofficial Dunblobbin website, this jaunty doorbell could be heard outside the park by locals who cursed the house. The lounge had sofas covered in floral patterned fabric and a TV set which looked like something straight out of the Flintstones.A large stuffed blobby dog slept on the floor - again, pink with yellow spots - and a blobby fish floated in a bowl.The walls bore portraits of Mr Blobby, his we and baby.In the kitchen, visitors could see the Blobby family lived on a diet of predominantly cake.And when they got to the bathroom they were in for a surprise - Mr Blobbys giant head poking out from behind a shower screen. Even the toilet was pink and spotty. The bedroom was filled with the sound of snoring, with Mrs Blobby snoring in bed and baby Blobby in his little pink cot. When the theme park closed in the late s, the buildings were left standing until they were discovered by urban explorers in . The explorers filmed their gem of a find and the resulting pictures and videos went viral among nostalgic s kids.
